results.adx_keywords: Running;Exercise;Longevity;Research
results.title: Even Short Runs Have Major Health Benefits
results.abstract: Jogging a mile or two a few times a week can help you live longer and reduce your risk of disease.

media.copyright: Keith E. Morrison for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Curling;Olympic Games (2026);Retirement Communities and Assisted Living;Age, Chronological;Content Type: Personal Profile;New Zealand;Calgary (Alberta);Canada
results.title: Olympic Hopefuls Needed a Home. A Retirement Community Stepped Up.
results.abstract: New Zealand’s curling team wanted to train with the “big boys” in Canada, and a group of enthusiastic seniors has provided housing, a cheering section and lots of advice.

media.caption: When Anton Hood and his teammates on New Zealand’s curling team needed a place to stay, the residents of Chartwell Colonel Belcher Retirement Residence, like Mary Gregoret, 80, were happy to help.
media.copyright: Todd Korol for The New York Times

results.byline: By David Segal and Ciril Jazbec
results.title: The Beekeepers Who Don’t Want You to Buy More Bees
results.abstract: In Slovenia and around the world, conservationists try — and mostly fail — to combat the widespread belief that honey bees are in danger.

media.copyright: Ciril Jazbec for The New York Times

results.abstract: How the events of that fateful year shaped the Israeli-Palestinian conflict for decades to come.

results.adx_keywords: Television;News and News Media;Israel-Gaza War (2023- );Jews and Judaism;Hamas;Fox News Channel
results.title: Jewish Viewers Find a Refuge in Fox News
results.abstract: The network’s unflinching support for Israel in its fight against Hamas has put the conservative network in the good graces of many Jews who see other coverage of Israel as biased.

media.caption: “Fox and Friends” interviewed people at the Second Avenue Deli in Manhattan who were assembled early in the morning before the restaurant’s usual opening time to discuss the Israel-Hamas war.
media.copyright: Natalie Keyssar for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Bezos, Jeffrey P;Amazon.com Inc;Blue Origin;Seattle (Wash);Miami (Fla)
results.title: Jeff Bezos Says He Is Leaving Seattle for Miami
results.abstract: The Amazon founder has lived in Seattle since 1994. He said he was returning to Miami, where he attended high school, in part to be closer to his parents.

media.caption: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez at Miami International Autodrome in May.

results.adx_keywords: New York City Marathon;Running;Bridges and Tunnels;Marathon Running;Parks and Other Recreation Areas
results.title: What It’s Actually Like to Run the New York City Marathon Route
results.abstract: Want to feel like the most beloved person on the planet? All you have to do is run 26.2 miles through New York City on Marathon Sunday.

media.caption: About 50,000 runners cross five bridges and touch all five boroughs in the New York City Marathon.
media.copyright: Joshua Bright for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Retirement Communities and Assisted Living;Real Estate and Housing (Residential);Retirement;Age, Chronological;Content Type: Personal Profile;vis-photo;Sun City Center (Fla);Florida
results.byline: By Debra Kamin and Scott McIntyre
results.title: The Youngest Senior
results.abstract: Moving to Florida for early retirement, a native New Jerseyan in her 50s is finding her third act to be the most fun in a community where the average age is 79.

media.caption: Drawn by the sunshine and a sense of community, Maria Hodge is now one of the youngest residents at Sun City Center, a 55-plus community near Tampa, Fla.

results.adx_keywords: Hearing Aids;Ears and Hearing;Research;Regulation and Deregulation of Industry;Elderly;Dementia;Food and Drug Administration;United States
results.title: Hearing Aids Are More Affordable, and Perhaps More Needed, Than Ever
results.abstract: Over-the-counter devices have been available for a year now. New research suggests they may have unexpected benefits.

results.adx_keywords: Elder Care;Retirement;Elderly;Retirement Communities and Assisted Living;Content Type: Service;Real Estate and Housing (Residential)
results.title: Ready to Retire? Consider Your Family First.
results.abstract: Some older adults are skipping a sun-drenched post-work life and moving instead to the next step: choosing to live near children and grandchildren.

media.caption: “We knew we would miss our friends but the pull of family was stronger,” said Joan Thompson, 77, of the decision she and her husband, Eric Thompson, 82, made to move from their longtime home in Baltimore, to Wake Robin, a retirement community in Shelburne, Vt., to be near their sons, Josh (left) and Matt.
media.copyright: Oliver Parini for The New York Times

results.title: U.S. Investigating Whether Adams Received Illegal Donations From Turkey

results.title: Can Humanities Survive the Budget Cuts?
results.abstract: After years of hand-wringing about their future, liberal arts departments now face the chopping block. At risk: French, German, American studies and women’s studies.

media.caption: West Virginia University has cut programs in areas like languages, landscape architecture and the arts. Some students are unhappy.

results.adx_keywords: Floods;Water;Rain;Parks and Other Recreation Areas;Global Warming;internal-open-access;Hoboken (NJ)
results.title: A Climate Change Success Story? Look at Hoboken.
results.abstract: This flood-prone city on the Hudson River has bundled water-absorbing infrastructure into benefits residents asked for, like parks and safer streets.

media.caption: The view of Lower Manhattan from Hoboken, across the Hudson River. Hoboken has adopted a series of strategies to grapple with water from both air and sea.
media.copyright: Daniel Arnold for The New York Times
